SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_010.text: Weird. I can't follow a thing this lady's saying. First time that's happened to me on this trip. Although maybe it's weirder that I could understand everyone so far.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_020.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_020.text:
Sinoso noyno kotowa noko gac?
Kowo soyo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_030.text:
Well, I sure as shoot can't
search for spirits like this.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_050.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_050.text:
Our apologies. Are you able
to understand us now?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_060.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_060.text:
Clear as a bell. You using some
kind of translation magic there?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_070.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_070.text:
Be welcome in this land,
Soyay the Pollinator,
for we have summoned you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_080.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_080.text:
I know what most of those words mean,
but not in that order, maybe?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_090.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_090.text:
By the power of the god of the Imeru,
we have summoned you, the 40,846th
Soyay the Pollinator, to guide the
Epuyke's maiden.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_091.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_091.text:
By the power of the god of we Imeru,
we have summoned you, Soyay the Pollinator,
to guide the Epuyke's maiden.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_100.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_100.text:
Guide the Epuyke's maiden, gotcha.
Just one thing: what's an Epuyke?
Oh, and what's this maiden's deal?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_110.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_110.text:
The Epuyke is the blossom which gives life
to all that is in this world—and the maiden
is she who keeps the Epuyke alive. If the Epuyke does not blossom, all life
will wither and fade. To prevent this fate,
the maiden must cause it to bloom.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_120.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_120.text:
And it is you, the Soyay,
who guides the Epuyke's maiden.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_130.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_130.text:
Feels like a pretty important job to
toss at some random outsider.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_140.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_140.text:
All is as the god of the Imeru wills it.
This is part of the original promise made
between the god of the Imeru and Ancikar—
the evil which slumbers in the earth. But this is not something you need understand.
All that is asked of you is to guide the
Epuyke's maiden. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_150.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_150.text:
Okay, sure. So what happens if I mess up in
whatever I gotta do while guiding this lady?
Or get booted outta here halfway through?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_170.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_170.text:
Gosh, I've been to some weird places
so far, but this one takes the cake. Well, no choice but to do what I gotta.
Heck, this Epuyke maiden might even be
the key to finding some spirits!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_180.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_180.text:
This maiden gal should be at the end of
the Emerald Wave. Let's go find her,
then worry about the rest later.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_100_CUT_000_000.speaker: Mother_Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_100_CUT_000_000.text:
Welcome! Welcome to Dura Village,
Soyay the Pollinator! We have been eagerly
awaiting your arrival. Please, come this way.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_100_CUT_000_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_100_CUT_000_010.text:
Boy, I didn't know the Soyay would be
welcomed so warmly. Guess this maiden
must really be a big deal.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_100_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_100_CUT_000_030.text:
You the Epuyke's maiden? Couple of gals
said I was supposed to lead you around,
but I don't quite know what that means.
Hope that's okay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_100_CUT_000_040.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_100_CUT_000_040.text:
I am Lela, the Epuyke's maiden
for this season. I have been waiting for a Soyay to accompany
me through my trials, for it is said that
when maiden and Soyay overcome such together,
the Epuyke will endure.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_100_CUT_000_050.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_100_CUT_000_050.text:
Oh, so that's how this works, eh?
Hope they're trials I can manage.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_100_CUT_000_060.speaker: Mother_Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_100_CUT_000_060.text:
The Epuyke ritual for the previous season has
already ended, and what time remains is short.
I apologize for having you set out so soon
after your arrival, but you must leave now.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_100_CUT_000_080.speaker: Mother_Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_100_CUT_000_080.text:
Lela's mother—and I am delighted beyond
words that a maiden of Epuyke has been
chosen from my bloodline. Once Lela blooms into the Epuyke flower,
our family will at last be secure.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_100_CUT_000_090.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_100_CUT_000_090.text:
Maybe I got wax in my ears, but it sounded 
like you just said your daughter's gonna
'bloom into the Epuyke.' Heck, I figured she was just going to...
I dunno. Toss some seeds around, maybe.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_100_CUT_000_100.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_100_CUT_000_100.text:
You heard correctly, traveler:
the maiden of the Epuyke becomes
the Epuyke blossom itself.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_100_CUT_000_110.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_100_CUT_000_110.text:
Is it normal for folks to turn
into flowers around here?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_100_CUT_000_120.speaker: Mother_Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_100_CUT_000_120.text:
Normal? Goodness, no! To become the Epuyke
is an indescribable honor that my family—
my daughter—has been chosen for.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_100_CUT_000_130.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_100_CUT_000_130.text:
You come from a different world, Soyay, so I
know this must all seem quite strange to you.
But the Epuyke will blossom soon, and I trust
you will understand when you see it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_100_CUT_000_140.speaker: Mother_Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_100_CUT_000_140.text:
Go forth now, Soyay, and cultivate
my daughter into a beautiful Epuyke.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_100_CUT_000_150.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_100_CUT_000_150.text:
Hey, I'll give it a shot,
but no promises. Oh, but if you don't mind my asking,
the fact your world still exists means
there's never been a Soyay who
abandoned the maiden, yeah?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_100_CUT_000_160.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_100_CUT_000_160.text:
Correct. Now please, we must depart.
There is no time for idle chatter.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_100_CUT_000_170.speaker: Mother_Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_100_CUT_000_170.text:
May all luck be with you, Lela.
Go forth proudly for the sake
of our family and our lineage.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_100_CUT_000_180.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_100_CUT_000_180.text:
Seems like I'm the only one who
finds any of this weird, so I guess
we'll just see where it goes. C'mon. Let's hustle.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_000_000.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_000_000.text:
I look forward to traveling with you
and completing the trials, Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_000_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_000_010.text:
Same, although I don't really get
a lick of what's going on here. But hey, so long as we're gettin' to
know each other, have you heard of
any spirits around here?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_000_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_000_020.text:
Spirits? No. In our world, we have only
the god of the Imeru, the god of the Kikir,
and the wicked god Ancikar. Does this have anything to do
with our trials, perchance?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_000_030.text:
Thing is, I came to this world to find spirits,
but then some ladies wandered up and told me
I was actually a Soyay who was gonna show the
Epuyke's maiden around. So, uh, here I am.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_000_040.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_000_040.text:
And sorry about that—I know it probably
doesn't thrill you to hear how little I know,
seein' as this maiden job is clearly a big deal.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_000_050.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_000_050.text:
I tried to picture what my Soyay might be
like after I was chosen to be the maiden,
but you are far, far different from
anything I ever imagined. That said, I do not feel nervous.
It is all simply...strange.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_000_060.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_000_060.text:
However, if the spirit you are searching
for happens to be Ancikar, it might prevent
me from blossoming into the Epuyke.
This would be a very sad thing indeed.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_000_070.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_000_070.text: So you want to turn into the Epuyke? That would make you happy?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_000_080.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_000_080.text:
The souls of all maidens who bloom into the
Epuyke live forever in the Maiden's Garden,
which is said to be a place of great joy. But I care not what sort of place
it might be; I care only that I will
finally see my Ahpe there again.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_000_100.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_000_100.text:
Ahpe is my only friend—one who is
undergoing preparations to bloom
into the Epuyke as we speak. The people claim she will no longer be Ahpe once
she becomes the Epuyke, but I do not believe this.
Ahpe will always be Ahpe—and when she blooms,
her soul will live on in the Maiden's Garden.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_000_110.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_000_110.text:
I have been alone since she left, and...
I miss her. So please guide me well,
that I might bloom into the Epuyke.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_000_120.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_000_120.text:
I hear you—and I promise
to give it everything I got.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_020_000.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_020_000.text:
Dreams of Ancikar—the evil who
slumbers deep within the earth—
have influenced this fiend.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_020_010.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_020_010.text:
Ancikar's dreams appear as fiends
during times of flood, but in times of
drought they appear as eggs instead. While we could easily crush the eggs,
none among us bother to do so,
for it is far simpler to just not travel
during times of flood.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_020_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_020_020.text:
Ancikar's fiends play an
important role, you see.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_030_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_030_000.text:
Cripes! Don't think I've ever seen a plant
that big, and I've sure never seen one
grow outta nowhere like that.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_030_010.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_030_010.text:
That is the Epuyke, the great blossom
that brings our worlds together. And...it is also Ahpe. My friend.
She has been reborn as the Epuyke,
and will become a bloom of great beauty.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_030_020.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_030_020.text: So that's the Epuyke and your friend? Gal really went through a growth spurt after that fight, eh?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_030_030.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_030_030.text:
That is the job of Ancikar's fiends.
When a fiend dies, Ancikar's dreams—
which birthed said fiends—are absorbed
by the Epuyke. The Epuyke then takes Ancikar's dreams,
converts them to nutrients, and grows.
In this way are we kept safe from Ancikar.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_030_040.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_030_040.text:
So the more fiends we kill, the bigger the
Epuyke grows? Heck, we should just get out
there and mow down whatever we find.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_030_050.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_030_050.text:
Yes. But if Ahpe's Epuyke grows too fast,
I will not be ready—for I must complete
my trials before it blossoms for Ahpe.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_030_060.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_030_060.text:
So feed Ahpe's Epuyke while we go
through your trials. Got it. Ha ha!
Kinda funny how much juggling
a guy's gotta do in this Soyay job.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_030_070.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_030_070.text:
To think one would find the role of a
Soyay funny... You are indeed much
different than I imagined.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_030_080.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_030_080.text:
Sorry about that. I know this is serious
business—didn't mean to poke fun.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_030_090.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DORA_110_CUT_030_090.text:
Worry not—each Soyay has their own way
of thinking and doing. I ask only that
you guide me true along my trials.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.text:
Welcome, Lela, Maiden of the Epuyke.
And you as well, Soyay the Pollinator.
I am the witness for the Trial of Strength.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.text:
Have you come to understand the Epuyke's
maiden a little better now, Soyay?
Are you ready to fulfill your role?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.text:
Honestly, bud, none of this made
much sense to me at first, but now
I'm raring to get after it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.text:
It is unusual to see a Soyay so
eager to take on their role! But resolution is not enough to lead the
Epuyke's maiden—you also need strength.
I ask that you show this to me now.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.text:
When your heart is truly close to the
Epuyke's maiden, only then will you
display your true strength as Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.text:
You speak of the present Epuyke,
who I hear was once your friend.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.text:
My apologies. I meant no offense. Ahpe's Soyay brilliantly overcame all
trials, which is why she bloomed into such
a healthy Epuyke. I only pray your Soyay
performs so admirably, Lela.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.text:
So what's the deal with this trial?
What do I need to do?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_1.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_1.text: You must locate a fiend and kill it— but a fiend that is not one of Ancikar's. You must find the fiend, Soyay. This is a part of your trial.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_1.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_1.text:
Find a fiend, kill a fiend.
This is gonna be a cinch.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_1.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_1.text:
Never have I seen a Soyay so arrogant!
But go then, Soyay the Pollinator,
and guide well our maiden of Epuyke.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_110_CUT_000_0.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_110_CUT_000_0.text:
Is this truly the place, Soyay?
I see nothing here.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_110_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_110_CUT_000_0.text:
Yep. The fiend we gotta beat down
should be around here somewhere.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_110_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_110_CUT_000_0.text:
I am the summoner of the strength fiends—
and I am surprised the two of you
discovered me so quickly.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_110_CUT_000_0.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_110_CUT_000_0.text:
If I may ask a question, Summoner?
I understand why the Soyay must fight,
but what meaning does the act hold
for a maiden like myself?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_110_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_110_CUT_000_0.text:
Once you witness the Soyay fighting,
you will understand in due course.
Do you stand ready, Soyay?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_110_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_110_CUT_000_0.text:
Then I shall summon the fiend.
O great god of the Kikir, bring us
a mighty fiend from a world beyond!
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.text:
Okay, bud, I found a fiend and took
the thing out. That means we're done
with the Trial of Strength, yeah?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.text:
Okay, so what's the deal here?
We killed the fiend, but the Epuyke
isn't growing at all.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.text:
This fiend was not born from Ancikar's dreams,
but summoned by the god of the Kikir from a world
beyond—summoned with the same power the god
of the Imeru uses to call Soyay the Pollinator.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.text:
We Kikir use this power to fight Ancikar's
dream creatures, and have lost warriors
beyond counting in our battle for this land.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.text:
You have displayed the strength needed to draw
close to the Epuyke's maiden's heart, Soyay.
But tell me, Lela: what did you feel when you
witnessed the Soyay in battle?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.text:
At first, I was afraid, my thoughts
dominated by what might happen
to me if the Soyay were to fail.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.text:
But as I watched his desperate battle,
I found myself wishing for his victory—
not for my own sake, but because I simply
wanted to see him win. And when he finally proved victorious,
my heart overflowed with joy.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.text:
I have been alone ever since Ahpe became
the Epuyke. But now, I am not; I can walk
forward proudly beside the Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.text:
Hear me, Lela, Maiden of the Epuyke:
I hereby deem you worthy to proceed
to the Trial of Love. I pray you will become our Epuyke, and ask
Soyay the Pollinator to guide you well.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_100_CUT_000_000.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_100_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Lela, maiden of the Epuyke!
Hail, Soyay the Pollinator!
I stand ready to bear witness
to the Trial of Love.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_100_CUT_000_010.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_100_CUT_000_010.text:
We Kikir, fellow residents of this world,
offer the Trial of Love to judge if you are
worthy to become the next season's Epuyke.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_100_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_100_CUT_000_020.text:
Can't wait to hear what
I gotta do for this one.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_100_CUT_000_030.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_100_CUT_000_030.text:
You must plant vine seeds within
the holes upon the plateau.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_100_CUT_000_040.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_100_CUT_000_040.text:
Small fiends of Ancikar may appear.
Defeat them to fertilize the seeds.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_100_CUT_000_050.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_100_CUT_000_050.text:
If the maiden holds true love in her heart,
the seeds will immediately germinate
and grow into mighty vines.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_100_CUT_000_060.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_100_CUT_000_060.text:
And if they do not? Does this mean
I lack love and am not an appropriate
choice for the Epuyke's maiden?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_100_CUT_000_070.speaker: Witness_of_Love

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_100_CUT_000_080.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_100_CUT_000_080.text:
Yeah, don't sweat it.
You'll be fine.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_100_CUT_000_090.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_100_CUT_000_090.text:
While I leave the decision of where to plant
the seeds to you, bear in mind these vines
will help our people move from place to place.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_100_CUT_000_100.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_100_CUT_000_100.text:
How fine it will be to move between
plateaus without encountering fiends
during times of flood!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_100_CUT_000_130.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_100_CUT_000_130.text:
Sorry, folks, but I don't speak...
whatever you're speaking.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_100_CUT_000_140.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_100_CUT_000_140.text:
You need not strain your
mental faculties, Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_100_CUT_000_150.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_100_CUT_000_150.text:
We said, 'May the Epuyke blossom
be protected.'

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_100_CUT_000_160.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_100_CUT_000_160.text:
Again, I pray for your success in
this trial. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_110_CUT_000_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_110_CUT_000_000.text:
Well, this sure looks like a hole.
Wanna give it a shot?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_110_CUT_000_010.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_110_CUT_000_010.text: Let us plant the seeds here.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_110_CUT_010_010.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_110_CUT_010_010.text:
Is my heart truly loving enough?
What if I fail?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_110_CUT_010_020.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_110_CUT_010_020.text:
Hey, so not to be rude or anything,
but if you've got time to stand there and
fret, you've got the time to lend a hand.
Plus, I'm pretty sure that'll count as love.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_110_CUT_010_040.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_110_CUT_010_040.text: Swell. Take care of the seeds.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_110_CUT_010_050.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_110_CUT_010_050.text:
All right, now we need fertilizer.
That witness fella said little fiends of Ancikar
will probably show up, so I figure that'll
happen any minute now...

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_110_CUT_020_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_110_CUT_020_000.text:
That takes care of the fertilizer.
Guess we wait for 'em to sprout now?
Guy said it'd happen immediately, but...

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_110_CUT_030_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_110_CUT_030_000.text:
Gosh, those fiends of Ancikar must
be packed with nutrition, eh?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_110_CUT_030_010.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_110_CUT_030_010.text:
It seems I have love in my heart after all.
But answer me this, Soyay the Pollinator:
do you have a name?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_110_CUT_030_020.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_110_CUT_030_020.text:
Sure do. The name's Tsunanori Mido.
Also, that's the first time anyone asked
my name since I came to this place.
Kind of a long name compared to yours, huh?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_000.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Lela, maiden of the Epuyke!
Hail, Soyay the Pollinator!
I stand ready to bear witness
to the Trial of Wisdom.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_010.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_010.text:
In this trial, you must collect fragments of
the Epuyke Tablet which have been scattered
across the land, put them back together,
and decipher the tale written upon it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_020.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_020.text:
Both tablet and tale are said to have been
created for the Epuyke's maiden by the god
of the Imeru—and to be the physical form
of Ancikar's dreams.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_030.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_030.text:
The maiden, upon blooming into the Epuyke,
is no longer a person. She becomes more
akin to a god—to a part of this earth. This trial is a test to see if
you possess the wisdom needed
to become a part of the earth.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_040.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_040.text:
Ahpe—I mean, the current Epuyke
collected these fragments as well,
did she not?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_050.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_050.text:
Ah, but she did more than simply collect
the fragments—she assembled the tablet,
deciphered the tale, and bloomed into
the Epuyke without being led astray. You have little time left,
Maiden Lela. Use it well.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_060.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_060.text:
Gotcha. So where do we start looking?
And how many of these fragment deals
are out there, anyway?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_070.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_070.text:
These are answers you know well, Soyay.
Now go lead the maiden.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_100_CUT_000_000.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_100_CUT_000_000.text:
This must be a fragment of the Epuyke Tablet.
There is something carved into it—writing,
perhaps? I fear I'll not be able to decipher
this even when fully assembled...

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_100_CUT_000_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_100_CUT_000_010.text:
Ahpe read the thing, right?
That means you can too.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_100_CUT_000_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_100_CUT_000_020.text:
Yes, I suppose you're right. Regardless,
it's probably best to save such worries
until we have the tablet fully assembled.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_100_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_100_CUT_000_030.text:
Who do you figure wrote all
this in the first place?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_110_CUT_000_000.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_110_CUT_000_000.text:
This is a fragment of
the Epuyke Tablet.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_110_CUT_000_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_110_CUT_000_010.text:
So do these things just pop outta the
ground whenever a maiden shows up?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_110_CUT_000_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_110_CUT_000_020.text:
I am not certain; this is my first time
seeing them for myself.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_110_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_110_CUT_000_030.text:
So you've never seen this
whole Epuyke Tablet deal?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_110_CUT_000_040.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_110_CUT_000_040.text:
Never. And now that I think on it,
I have never met another who has,
either. I wonder why that is.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_120_CUT_000_000.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_120_CUT_000_000.text:
This is a fragment of
the Epuyke Tablet.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_120_CUT_000_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_120_CUT_000_010.text:
These fragments don't feel like they're
made out of stone or wood. It's more like...
Well, something weird.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_120_CUT_000_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_120_CUT_000_020.text:
It feels the same as the
husks of our birth seeds.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_130_CUT_000_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_130_CUT_000_010.text:
I wonder what it says, though.
Something about the Epuyke's
frame of mind, maybe?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_130_CUT_000_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_130_CUT_000_020.text:
Ahpe read the tablet and became the Epuyke,
so the actual meaning matters very little.
I merely need to read it and bloom into
the Epuyke, as she did.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_130_CUT_000_030.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_130_CUT_000_030.text:
Let us return to the Witness to Wisdom
and assemble this as best we can.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_110_CUT_000_000.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_110_CUT_000_000.text:
Maiden Lela, you have collected
all the Epuyke Tablet fragments.
Now put them together, if you can.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_110_CUT_010_010.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_110_CUT_010_010.text:
Thus marks the end of the Trial of Wisdom.
Whether you choose to speak of the message
written on the tablet or keep it to yourself
is a decision made at your discretion.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_110_CUT_010_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_110_CUT_010_020.text:
How strange... I do not know this writing,
but when I put it together, I can read it.
I believe I am closer to the Epuyke now.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_110_CUT_010_030.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_110_CUT_010_030.text: Take all the time you need.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_110_CUT_999_000.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_110_CUT_999_000.text:
Oh, but this is impossible! I am not meant
to be the Epuyke's maiden! I will never see
my beloved Ahpe again! I will be alone until
my foliage withers and—

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_110_CUT_999_010.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_110_CUT_999_010.text:
There have been other maidens who have been
unable to overcome every trial, Lela—but you
must not give up. All is according to the will
of the Imeru's god, after all.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_110_CUT_999_020.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_110_CUT_999_020.text:
And if that lady says it, you know it's true.
Now get your head back in the game, yeah?
You're not alone here.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_110_CUT_999_060.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_110_CUT_999_060.text:
So be it, Lela, Maiden of the Epuyke.
So be it, Soyay the Pollinator.
All I can do now is pray you safely
finish the ritual. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_110_CUT_020_000.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_110_CUT_020_000.text:
I did it! I read it!
Now I can finally meet Ahpe!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_110_CUT_020_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_110_CUT_020_010.text:
Looks like somebody's chipper.
What'd it say?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_110_CUT_020_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_110_CUT_020_020.text:
It was from Ahpe—she's waiting for me at the
Maiden's Garden! She even wrote about a secret
only she and I know, so it HAS to be from her! Oh, but I am so happy! I'm going to bloom
into a beautiful Epuyke and see her again!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_110_CUT_020_030.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_110_CUT_020_030.text:
Wait, so the Maiden's Garden actually exists?
'Cause not to be rude, but it sure sounded
like something she made up... But heck, if she believes in the place,
I guess I will too.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_110_CUT_020_050.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_110_CUT_020_050.text:
With its role fulfilled, the tablet crumbles
to dust so none but the maiden might know
its tale. Such is the will of the Imeru's god.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_110_CUT_020_060.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_110_CUT_020_060.text:
Hear me, Lela, Maiden of the Epuyke!
Hear me, Soyay the Pollinator!
I pray that you might safely finish
the Epuyke ritual. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_110_CUT_030_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_110_CUT_030_020.text:
It detailed all that has come to pass,
and all that is yet to come. Indeed,
I feel it is some manner of prophecy. But I also fear it might come across
in a negative way were I to speak of it,
so I think it best that I keep the
details to myself.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_110_CUT_030_030.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_110_CUT_030_030.text:
If that's what your gut tells you,
let's roll with it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_000.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_000.text:
At last you have come, Lela,
next Maiden of the Epuyke. This season's Epuyke blossomed full and
beautiful. It absorbed the dreams of the
evil god Ancikar who slumbers underground,
then brilliantly returned to the earth.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_010.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_010.text:
We wish for you to bloom
just as beautifully.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_020.text: So Ahpe did it. She became the Epuyke.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_030.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_030.text:
Ahpe! It's me, Lela!
Can you see me!?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_040.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_040.text:
That is but the Epuyke, Lela.
The one who was called Ahpe is no more.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_050.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_050.text:
Hey, don't sweat it; you know the Epuyke
better than any of these other folks.
Heck, that's why the Imeru god chose you!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_060.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_060.text:
I suggest you choose your words
more carefully, Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_070.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_070.text:
Hey, it's the god of the Imeru who brought
me here in the first place, right? If you've got
a problem with how I'm going about things,
take it up with your big fella upstairs.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_080.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_080.text: I'm all right. Thank you, Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_090.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_090.text:
We are beginning the Epuyke festival.
The Epuyke's pollen will now rain down
upon the earth, and we grant you special
permission to acquire it for yourself.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_100.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_100.text:
Now go, before the Kikir
collect it all.

SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_100_CUT_000_000.speaker: Kikiris1
SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_100_CUT_000_000.text:
The Epuyke bloomed again this season!
We're getting our pollen!

SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_100_CUT_000_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_100_CUT_000_010.text:
You say it like this deal just
happens naturally.

SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_100_CUT_000_020.speaker: Kikiris2
SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_100_CUT_000_020.text:
What, would you rather we talk
like we grew it ourselves?

SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_110_CUT_000_000.speaker: Kikiris1
SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_110_CUT_000_000.text:
Another season, another successful
Epuyke festival.

SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_110_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_110_CUT_000_020.text:
Y'know, this whole thing only works
because of the maiden, so you should
be thanking her, maybe.

SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_110_CUT_000_030.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_110_CUT_000_030.text:
I only hope I can get through
this without issue.

SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_120_CUT_000_000.speaker: Kikiris1
SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_120_CUT_000_000.text:
The Epuyke's pollen! Hooray!
We get our nutrients from this!

SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_120_CUT_000_010.speaker: Kikiris2
SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_120_CUT_000_010.text:
So tasty! Epuyke forever!
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_120_CUT_000_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_120_CUT_000_020.text:
I wonder if the evil deity Ancikar
truly does slumber underground.

SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_120_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_120_CUT_000_030.text:
I suppose we'd find out if the Epuyke died,
but that's probably not something we want
to happen, yeah?

SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_120_CUT_000_040.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_120_CUT_000_040.text:
Yes, I suppose the only ones who know for
certain are those in the Maiden's Garden.

SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_130_CUT_000_000.speaker: Kikiris1
SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_130_CUT_000_000.text:
Eee hee hee! Festival time!
Epuyke pollen time!

SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_130_CUT_000_010.speaker: Kikiris2
SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_130_CUT_000_010.text:
The Kikir LOVE Epuyke pollen!
Yummy yummy!

SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_130_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_130_CUT_000_020.text:
Geez, if this stuff's really all that,
I should probably try a little.

SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_130_CUT_000_030.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_130_CUT_000_030.text:
Do not. Though its form may have changed,
this pollen was once the dreams of evil Ancikar.
If ingested you will become unable to live without it,
just like these Kikir.

SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_140_CUT_000_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_140_CUT_000_020.text: Yes, I am in the middle of my trials.

SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_140_CUT_000_030.speaker: Kikiris1
SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_140_CUT_000_030.text:
Please bloom into a beautiful Epuyke
and feed us more delicious pollen.

SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_150_CUT_000_010.speaker: Kikiris2
SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_150_CUT_000_010.text:
Yummy, yummy! Such full tummy!
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_010.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_010.text:
There is little pollen left on the Epuyke.
All that remains is for it to wither,
decay, and become one with the earth.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_020.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_020.text: The Epuyke has little time remaining.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_030.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_030.text:
This means the ritual for the maiden
to bloom into the next Epuyke will
begin very soon.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_040.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_040.text:
We pray you might safely complete your
trials and blossom into an Epuyke that
rivals the one of this season.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_050.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_050.text:
Needless to say, I will do
all within my power.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_060.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_060.text:
You show promise, Maiden.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_000.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Maiden Lela!
Hail, Soyay the Pollinator!
The time for the ritual has come.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_010.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_010.text:
The Epuyke has bloomed and withered.
Its soul has returned to the earth,
and now watches over and protects us.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_020.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_020.text:
And since the Epuyke absorbed Ancikar's
fell magic before it returned to the earth,
we now enjoy this brief moment of peace.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_030.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_030.text:
Alas, this is naught but a junction.
Maiden, the time has come for you
to be reborn anew into the Epuyke.
The time has come for the ritual.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_050.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_050.text: Am I going to see Ahpe, Tsunanori?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_090.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_090.text:
The maiden has been reborn
as the Epuyke's seed.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_110.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_110.text:
This is your final task, Soyay the Pollinator:
you must plant the Epuyke's seed in the earth.
Send it to Ancikar, that it might trap the wicked
god in slumber. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_000.text:
We were together when we planted the vine
seeds, Lela, and I guess you're still with
me in your own way. So...good luck.
I hope you grow up real strong.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_020.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_020.text:
You have borne witness to the Imeru's Epuyke
festival as the 40,846th Soyay the Pollinator.
I now pronounce you freed from your duty.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_030.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_030.text:
That's swell, but do you think I
can maybe stick around until Lela...
Er, until the Epuyke blooms?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_040.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_040.text:
Half the Soyays remain to watch the Epuyke
bloom, while the other half run away as
if for their very lives. I see now which
manner of Soyay you are.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_050.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_050.text:
Yeah, to be honest, I came here looking for
spirits, but now... Well, I guess things are
pretty different, and I feel like I should
see this deal through to the end.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_060.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_060.text:
And yet, you are now merely a man.
We cannot stand here speaking to you,
for we must be off to greet the
40,847th Soyay the Pollinator.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_070.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_070.text:
Guess that means you also found
the next Epuyke's maiden, eh?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_080.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_080.text:
You are no longer Soyay the Pollinator.
Such matters do not concern you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_090.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_090.text:
Can't really argue with that.
Guess I'll let the next Soyay
worry about the next maiden.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_100.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_100.text:
Epuyke nogonoa kowo to you,
the 40,846th Soyay the Pollinator!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_020_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_020_000.text:
Hey there, Lela. Can you hear me?
You bloomed into a real amazing flower
there—you should be dang proud.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_020_020.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_020_020.text:
Holy smokes! You can hear me, Lela!?
You can hear my voice?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_020_040.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_020_040.text:
Beautiful as anything. I mean, Ahpe's
Epuyke was nice, but your blossoms
beat hers any day of the week.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_020_060.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_020_060.text:
Hey, speaking of Ahpe,
did you find her yet?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_020_090.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_100_CUT_020_090.text: Gone off to the Maiden's Garden.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_END_POLLEN_100_CUT_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_END_POLLEN_100_CUT_000.text:
Well, this is your pollen, Lela—
and since I'm your Soyay, I guess
it's my job to take it with me.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_END_POLLEN_100_CUT_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_END_POLLEN_100_CUT_000.text:
I get it now. I understand.
And I'll use this power wisely.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_END_POLLEN_100_CUT_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_END_POLLEN_100_CUT_010.text: Guess this is really the end.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_010.text:
The name's Tsunanori Mido, and I came
to this world in search of spirits.
You happen to know anything about 'em?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_030.text:
Well, I know I'm in the right place.
I didn't come here 'cause I was summoned,
but because I chose to do it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_050.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_050.text:
Pardon us. It seems none of what
we said got through to you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_060.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_060.text:
Feels like language isn't
the only barrier here...

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_080.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_080.text:
Doesn't seem like you give two
toots about what I have to say.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_090.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_090.text:
By the power of the god of we Imeru,
we have summoned you, the 80,136th
Soyay the Pollinator, to guide the
Epuyke's maiden.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_100.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_100.text:
And like usual, I'm guessing this job
will lead me to spirits somehow.
So what's the deal here?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_130.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_130.text:
Guide? Heck, lady, I don't know anything about
this world—if I start showin' people around,
this maiden and me are gonna end up in a ditch
with a couple of broken legs.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_150.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_150.text:
So this god is planning for us to fall
in a ditch? Guess that means the evil
fella is the one diggin' all the holes. I mean, not to be rude, but the whole
deal seems pretty dang irresponsible—
especially for the poor maiden.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_170.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_170.text:
It's rude to throw gibberish at a guy
and then split, lady! Well, heck. Guess this Epuyke maiden is
gonna be how I track down my spirits.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_000.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_000.text:
Welcome to Doroso Village,
Soyay the Pollinator.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_020.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_020.text:
No. I am Kup, younger sister to this
year's maiden, Chup. My sister—

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_030.text:
Her sister does not WANT to be
the stupid Maiden of the Epuyke,
thank you very much. Look, you're the Soyay, right? How about you
just get me out of here and take me back
to whatever world you came from?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_040.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_040.text:
This maiden deal must be a real
rough gig, considering how badly
you don't want to do it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_050.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_050.text:
But we must have a maiden, Sister!
Elsewise the land will wither away!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_070.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_070.text:
I would love to, Sister—AND I'd do a
much better job than you! But I can't,
because the markings of the Imeru
are already on you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_080.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_080.text:
This year's Epuyke is already budding!
If you don't do your part as the maiden,
we're all going to die!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_090.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_090.text:
Meh, who cares? If we die, all the
clerics in the city will just say,
'This, too, is fate!' or whatever.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_100.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_100.text:
Why are you ALWAYS like this, Chup!?
You run around doing whatever you want,
which means I have to behave like a
good girl because you NEVER do! IT'S NOT FAAAIR! WAAAAAAH!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_110.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_110.text:
Yikes. Guess sisters fight the same
no matter what world you're in.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_120.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_120.text:
Ugh. Fiiine. Whatever. I'll do it.
Sheesh! I just wanted to give her
a bit of a hard time, but then she
started crying and made it weird.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_130.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_130.text:
Come on then, Soyay.
Let's go do the trials.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_140.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_140.text:
Okay, Kup, I'm off to do the trials,
but I don't know if it'll go well—and
to be honest, I still had lots of things
I wanted to do in life. Happy now?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_160.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_160.text:
So some cleric ladies told me to guide you,
but I don't have the slightest clue what that
actually means. Am I supposed to help you
with these trial deals, maybe?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_170.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_170.text:
Tradition says the Maiden of the Epuyke must
walk with the Soyay. As she does, she finds her
resolve to become the Epuyke by completing
trials of power, wisdom, and love.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_180.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_180.text:
Wow. The little sister's way ahead
of the big one on this stuff.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_190.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_190.text:
Oh, that's something all Imeru know.
Sis is just...special.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_200.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_200.text:
Well, probably shouldn't worry your
little sister too much, eh, Sis?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_210.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_210.text:
Uh-uh, mister! No way! My name's Chup,
and you don't get to call me 'Sis!'
...Only Kup can call me that.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_220.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_220.text:
Please, Sis! You have to formally
request the Soyay's help!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_230.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_230.text:
Fine, whatever. Please help me,
O great Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_000.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_000.text:
Man, no matter what argument we're
having, once she busts out the tears
it's my loss. It's always been like that,
ever since we were little.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_010.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_010.text:
And now, for some who-knows-why reason,
I'm this season's Maiden of the Epuyke
even though my earnest little sister
would be WAY better at it! Sucks for you having to be
the Soyay in my season.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_020.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_020.text:
Heck, kiddo, we're in the same boat.
Not like I asked to do this Soyay
thing, either.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_030.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_030.text: Wait, so I'm the one in trouble here!? Well in that case, I'm glad it's me here instead of my little sister. I mean, not that any of it matters; this Epuyke festival is probably the last one anyway.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_040.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_040.text:
Uh, but doesn't that mean
the world's gonna end?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_050.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_050.text:
Probably? I don't really know the details;
it's the god of the Imeru who picks the
Maiden and the Soyay and all that. All I know is that I don't want to make
my sister cry again, so you better do
your damn job properly, mister!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_060.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_060.text:
Properly? Heck, I don't even know
how to do it improperly.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_070.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_070.text:
Ugh, this is just the worst.
You're the Soyay, remember?
It's YOUR job to lead ME. Anyway, the trials. There are three of
them, so please just...do your job.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.text:
Welcome, Chup, Maiden of the Epuyke.
And you as well, Soyay the Pollinator.
I am the witness for the Trial of Strength.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.text:
Answer me, Maiden! Do you understand
why Soyay the Pollinator must now face
the Trial of Strength?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.text:
Yeah, it's because I can't fight—but
I don't get why that means he has to.
I mean, all I have to do here is turn
into the Epuyke, right?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.text:
In order to bloom into the Epuyke, you must
defeat Ancikar's fiends. If the current Epuyke
does not blossom, it means the next maiden
will never take her rightful place.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.text:
Which means I'll stay the maiden forever
and never become the Epuyke...which I
wouldn't mind, if we're being honest.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.text:
If the Epuyke does not blossom, we will never
receive its pollen. We Kikir toil day in and day
out so we might receive this gift, and it is the
duty of the maiden and Soyay to make it so!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.text:
Makes sense to me—I mean, sorta?
Anyway, let's get it over with.
What do I have to do?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.text: You must locate a fiend and kill it— but a fiend that is not one of Ancikar's. You must find the fiend, Soyay. This is a part of your trial.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.text:
That's all? Heck, I was ready for all
kinds of shenanigans when I heard about
some Trial of Strength, but this thing's
gonna be over by supper.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.text:
Wow, someone's confident.
Hope that's justified.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_1.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_1.text:
And now, Soyay the Pollinator,
guide well the Maiden of the Epuyke!
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_210_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_210_CUT_000_0.text:
Well, we're at a big empty spot.
What do I do now?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_210_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_210_CUT_000_0.text:
Nothing. This is where I find
the fiend I'm supposed to kill.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_210_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_210_CUT_000_0.text:
I am the summoner of the Fiend of Strength,
and am glad the two of you discovered me.
Now watch as I bring forth the fiend into
this world!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_210_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_210_CUT_000_0.text: Hey. Is this really going to be okay?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_210_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_210_CUT_000_0.text:
Well, Epuyke nogonoa kowo,
I guess?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_210_CUT_010_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_210_CUT_010_0.text:
Well, that's one dead fiend.
Thought that would be harder, honestly.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_210_CUT_010_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_210_CUT_010_0.text:
You have done well in the Trial of Strength,
Maiden, and I pray you might bloom into a
beautiful Epuyke. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_210_CUT_010_0.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_210_CUT_010_0.text:
Wait, is that really it?
I mean, uh, Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_200_CUT_000_000.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_200_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Chup, maiden of the Epuyke!
Hail, Soyay the Pollinator!
I stand ready to bear witness
to the Trial of Love. Your task is thus: take these
vine seeds and plant them in
the holes upon the plateaus.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_200_CUT_000_010.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_200_CUT_000_010.text:
Small fiends of Ancikar may appear—defeat them
to fertilize the seeds. If the maiden holds true
love in her heart, the seeds will immediately
germinate and grow into mighty vines.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_200_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_200_CUT_000_020.text:
So we're spreading vine seeds?
What's so romantic about that?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_200_CUT_000_030.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_200_CUT_000_030.text:
The vines that grow will aid you
and all the people. This is love.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_200_CUT_000_040.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_200_CUT_000_040.text: Yeaaah, sorry, but I don't really have love in my heart—and I absolutely don't want or need to help 'the people.'

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_200_CUT_000_060.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_200_CUT_000_060.text:
I just don't need this creep pushing a bunch
of stupid charity work on me when I'm already
busy trying not to make my sister cry!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_200_CUT_000_070.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_200_CUT_000_070.text:
Take the seeds of the transport vines,
and know I will pray for you to safely
overcome your trial. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_200_CUT_000_080.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_200_CUT_000_080.text: Cripes, this guy doesn't give up.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_210_CUT_000_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_210_CUT_000_000.text:
Well, this looks like a seed hole.
Whatcha think, champ?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_210_CUT_010_000.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_210_CUT_010_000.text:
Look, let's just throw the seeds on the
ground and let 'em grow on their own.
That's what seeds do.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_210_CUT_010_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_210_CUT_010_010.text:
Sure, but they need nutrients and all that,
yeah? Also pretty sure that bug fella said
something about a fiend appearing, so...

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_210_CUT_020_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_210_CUT_020_000.text:
Well, spread the seeds and gave 'em
fertilizer. That should take care of that.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_210_CUT_030_000.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_210_CUT_030_000.text:
Am I one of these vines?
Or am I a fiend of Ancikar?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_000.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Chup, Maiden of the Epuyke!
Hail, Soyay the Pollinator!
I stand ready to bear witness
to the Trial of Wisdom.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_010.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_010.text:
Do you understand what this
trial entails, Maiden?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_020.text:
Um... You're gonna give me a test
to see how smart I am?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_030.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_030.text:
Our intelligence is nothing in comparison
to the god of the Imeru. No, the wisdom
asked of you here will determine if you
can reflect upon yourself.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_040.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_040.text:
I sense confusion in your mien,
so permit me to explain. In this trial, you must collect fragments of
the Epuyke Tablet which have been scattered
across the land, put them back together,
and decipher the tale written upon it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_070.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_070.text:
And I can understand the tale
if I'm wise enough?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_080.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_080.text:
Precisely so—for only the Epuyke's
maiden can decipher the story.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_090.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_090.text:
So how many fragments are we talkin' here,
bud? Also, where are they? Or is this trial
all about finding 'em without hints?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_100.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_100.text:
These are answers you know well, Soyay,
for this is what it means to be you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_130.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_130.text:
I always get tongue-tied saying this,
but...Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_200_CUT_000_000.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_200_CUT_000_000.text:
This is a fragment of the Epuyke Tablet,
but I have ZERO idea what it says.
...Does that mean I'm stupid?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_200_CUT_000_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_200_CUT_000_010.text:
Eh, I bet you can read it once you
put the whole thing together.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_200_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_200_CUT_000_020.text:
Okay, whew! I was worried for
a hot second there. But CAN I put them together, though?
And can I even FIND all the fragments
since my Soyay is so...you?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_200_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_200_CUT_000_030.text:
You know I’m doing my
best here, right?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_200_CUT_000_040.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_200_CUT_000_040.text:
Yeah, I'm sorry. I mean, my sister and I have
special memories of this place, but there's
no way you'd have known that. Honestly, the fact you even found it
probably proves you're a decent Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_200_CUT_000_050.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_200_CUT_000_050.text: Place is special to you, eh?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_200_CUT_000_060.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_200_CUT_000_060.text:
Yeah, it was a popular place to search for
pretty rocks when we were kids—we used
to run around looking for these big, shiny
pieces of crystal. ...And whenever my sister found one,
I would take it and claim it for myself.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_200_CUT_000_070.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_200_CUT_000_070.text:
I really am a terrible person...
But I guess that doesn't matter now,
because my memories will all vanish
as soon as I become the Epuyke...

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_200_CUT_000_080.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_200_CUT_000_080.text:
Whoops! Man, listen to me!
Talking like my becoming the
Epuyke is guaranteed to happen.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_210_CUT_000_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_210_CUT_000_010.text:
So do these things just pop outta the
ground whenever a maiden shows up?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_210_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_210_CUT_000_020.text:
I guess so? I mean, you never see them,
and it's not like anyone's come up and
shown me one either.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_210_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_210_CUT_000_030.text: Probably speaks to how valuable they are.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_210_CUT_000_040.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_210_CUT_000_040.text:
Wanna take this back with you, then?
Sell it for mad cash?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_210_CUT_000_050.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_210_CUT_000_050.text:
...KIDDING! Ha ha, your face! Y'know, I come here by myself sometimes
to take in the view of the Epuyke.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_210_CUT_000_060.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_210_CUT_000_060.text:
I've always wondered what it feels like to
turn into the Epuyke, but I never thought
I'd...you know. Find out for myself?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_210_CUT_000_070.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_210_CUT_000_070.text:
So how do you feel about it now?
I mean, feel free to not answer that
if you don't want to.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_210_CUT_000_080.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_210_CUT_000_080.text:
I'm...not sure. But it's not like I don't feel
anything at all. I do. It's just that whatever
I'm feeling is really hard to explain.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_220_CUT_000_000.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_220_CUT_000_000.text:
And there's an Epuyke Tablet fragment.
They feel the exact same as the husks
of our birth seeds, so I can always tell.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_220_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_220_CUT_000_020.text:
Wait, are you NOT!?
Eeeeeew! Groooss!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_220_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_220_CUT_000_030.text:
...KIDDING! Yes, again.
Don't get all offended. You know, I wish you'd talk more about
yourself. Like, how you're born and
stuff like that? But I guess we don't
really have that kind of time, huh?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_220_CUT_000_040.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_220_CUT_000_040.text:
But, um, hey. If I do actually manage
to become the Epuyke, will you...
tell my sister about your world?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_230_CUT_000_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_230_CUT_000_010.text:
Wonder what it says? The mantis fella
said it'd be something about reflecting
on yourself, but that doesn't mean much
to this guy.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_230_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_230_CUT_000_020.text:
What if it said, 'Ha ha! Just kidding!
You're not the maiden after all!'

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_230_CUT_000_040.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_230_CUT_000_040.text:
Well, we'll never know until you
put the thing back together,
so let's head back.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_210_CUT_000_000.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_210_CUT_000_000.text:
Maiden Chup, you have collected
all the Epuyke Tablet fragments.
Now put them together, if you can.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_210_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_210_CUT_000_030.text:
Epi... Epa...? Uhhh...
Oh, right. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_210_CUT_010_010.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_210_CUT_010_010.text:
Thus marks the end of the Trial of Wisdom.
Whether you choose to speak of the message
written on the tablet or keep it to yourself
is a decision made at your discretion.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_210_CUT_010_030.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_210_CUT_010_030.text:
Of course. It is a revelation
meant for you alone.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_210_CUT_999_000.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_210_CUT_999_000.text:
I don't think I can do this...
I wasn't the Epuyke's maiden after all.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_210_CUT_999_010.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_210_CUT_999_010.text:
There have been other maidens who have been
unable to overcome every trial, Chup—but you
must not give up. All is according to the will
of the Imeru's god, after all.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_210_CUT_999_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_210_CUT_999_020.text:
Aw, man! I thought the maidens could
quit halfway through if they wanted,
but I guess not. Can't believe you're making me go through
this whole thing even though you know
how much I suck at it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_210_CUT_999_050.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_210_CUT_999_050.text: Eh, forget it. Let's just go.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_210_CUT_999_060.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_210_CUT_999_060.text:
So be it, Chup, Maiden of the Epuyke.
So be it, Soyay the Pollinator.
All I can do now is pray you safely
finish the ritual. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_210_CUT_020_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_210_CUT_020_020.text:
It was all about my little sister—about how
she's always loved me even though all I've
ever done is cause problems for our family.
...I think I understand now why I was chosen.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_210_CUT_020_050.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_210_CUT_020_050.text:
Hear me, Chup, Maiden of the Epuyke!
Hear me, Soyay the Pollinator!
I pray that you might safely finish
the Epuyke ritual. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_210_CUT_030_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_210_CUT_030_020.text: It's a secret. One just for me.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_210_CUT_030_030.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_210_CUT_030_030.text:
The words of the tablet may remain
forever in your heart if you wish it.
My role is to witness, not to know.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_200_CUT_000_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_200_CUT_000_000.text:
Right. Where to next, kiddo?
...Uh, kiddo? ...Chup? ...Hello?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_200_CUT_000_010.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_200_CUT_000_010.text:
What is the matter,
Soyay the Pollinator?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_200_CUT_000_030.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_200_CUT_000_030.text:
So she has run. Well, it is not as
though this is unprecedented.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_200_CUT_000_040.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_200_CUT_000_040.text:
If we cannot find the maiden before the
Epuyke withers, we will have no choice
but to graft.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_200_CUT_000_050.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_200_CUT_000_050.text: Gonna have to fill me in there.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_200_CUT_000_060.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_200_CUT_000_060.text:
Grafting involves choosing a substitute
from the maiden's direct family and
casting the spell on them.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_200_CUT_000_080.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_200_CUT_000_080.text:
The maiden alone does not face the trials.
Tens of thousands of times have we repeated
the Epuyke ritual, and in that span we have
seen all manner of circumstances.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_200_CUT_000_100.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_200_CUT_000_100.text:
We will cast the spell on the maiden's
little sister, Kup, and form her in a way
that is as close to Chup as possible.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_200_CUT_000_120.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_200_CUT_000_120.text:
I had been hoping the god of the Imeru might
choose Kup to begin with, for I feared exactly
this outcome. But alas, the ways of the divine
are mysterious, even to us.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_200_CUT_000_130.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_200_CUT_000_130.text:
Now hold on just a second there, lady!
Chup loves her sister—she'd never force
all of this on her by running away.
Just wait a bit, eh? She'll be back.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_200_CUT_000_140.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_200_CUT_000_140.text:
We can wait only until the Epuyke withers.
If she does not return before then,
Kup must be grafted.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_210_CUT_000_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_210_CUT_000_010.text:
You seen your sister
around here, maybe?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_210_CUT_000_040.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_210_CUT_000_040.text:
You must stay here, Kup. We cannot
risk your running off as well.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_210_CUT_000_050.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_210_CUT_000_050.text:
I trust you are familiar with the spell
of grafting? We are considering it as
a possible option.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_210_CUT_000_070.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_210_CUT_000_070.text:
She must have some reason for this,
'cause the last thing in the world
she'd want to do is hurt you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_210_CUT_000_080.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_210_CUT_000_080.text:
No, it's all right. I'll be the maiden
if that's what Sis wants. But...

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_210_CUT_000_090.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_210_CUT_000_090.text:
But before I do, I have to talk to her.
Please, Soyay. Find her for me.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_210_CUT_000_100.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_210_CUT_000_100.text:
You just sit tight. Even if I don't
find her, I bet you anything she'll
come back on her own.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_210_CUT_000_110.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_210_CUT_000_110.text:
Make haste, Soyay the Pollinator, for
you have only until the Epuyke withers.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_220_CUT_000_000.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_220_CUT_000_000.text:
Ugh, you found me ALREADY?
Seriously, what even are you?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_220_CUT_000_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_220_CUT_000_010.text:
You should've at least left a note
or something before you bailed.
I was pretty worried.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_220_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_220_CUT_000_020.text:
I just wanted to be alone, okay? I wanted to
think about how I might look as the Epuyke,
and how the whole thing might...feel. And I was really close to an answer,
but then YOU showed up! Ugh!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_220_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_220_CUT_000_030.text:
Hey, I get that, but we're outta time.
The clerics are gonna graft your
little sister if we don't get back
to the village lickety-split.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_220_CUT_000_050.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_220_CUT_000_050.text:
Yep. So we need to get
back, and I mean quick.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_221_CUT_000_010.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_221_CUT_000_010.text:
I'm sorry, I'm sorry, I'm sooorry!
Your dumb big sister took a little detour,
and now everybody's lost their damn minds.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_221_CUT_000_020.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_221_CUT_000_020.text:
Should the Epuyke vanish, Ancikar will begin
to awaken. You carry a great burden as the
Maiden of Epuyke, Chup—do you seek to have
this lifted from your shoulders?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_221_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_221_CUT_000_030.text:
Look, I wasn't running away, okay?
I just needed a little alone time. But I'm back now, so just leave
my sister out of this and let
me finish the stupid thing!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_221_CUT_000_060.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_221_CUT_000_060.text:
I got this, Kup. It's okay.
I'm your big sister, after all.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_230_CUT_000_010.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_230_CUT_000_010.text:
Oh. Hey, Soyay. Sorry for taking off,
but I just had this random thought. So remember how I told you about the
pretty rocks when we came here? Well,
I wanted to find a nice one for Kup.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_230_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_230_CUT_000_020.text:
That's great, kiddo, but if you
don't hurry back, they're gonna
graft your little sister.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_230_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_230_CUT_000_030.text:
What!? Oh, come on already!
Why doesn't anyone here TRUST me?
I mean, I was CHOSEN, remember!?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_230_CUT_000_040.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_230_CUT_000_040.text:
Yeah, those cleric ladies don't
actually seem to put a lot of faith
in the stuff their god does. But if you still want to do this thing,
you have to get back there lickety-split,
'cause they're not really the patient types.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_230_CUT_000_050.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_230_CUT_000_050.text:
But I still haven't found a good rock!
Search with me, Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_230_CUT_000_060.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_230_CUT_000_060.text:
Good call there.
Findin' stuff's kinda my thing.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_231_CUT_000_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_231_CUT_000_010.text: Which is what we're looking for!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_231_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_231_CUT_000_020.text:
Are you SURE you're good at finding stuff?
Or that you're even really the Soyay?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_231_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_231_CUT_000_030.text:
Oh, whoa... This is so pretty...
But isn't it a piece of an Ancikar fiend?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_231_CUT_000_040.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_231_CUT_000_040.text:
Nah, it's just an eggshell—I don't get
the heebie-jeebies from it at all.
Now let's hurry back, yeah?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_232_CUT_000_040.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_232_CUT_000_040.text:
Hey, Kup. So remember how we used to collect
rocks and I'd always take whatever you found?
I know it was a long time ago, but I'm still sorry.
So...I got you this.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_232_CUT_000_060.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_232_CUT_000_060.text:
The Soyay helped me find it.
Pretty great, huh?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_232_CUT_000_070.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RUN_232_CUT_000_070.text:
Thank you, Sis.
I'll always treasure it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_000.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_000.text:
At last you have come, Chup,
Maiden of the Epuyke. This season's Epuyke blossomed full and
beautiful. It absorbed the dreams of the
evil god Ancikar who slumbers underground,
then brilliantly returned to the earth.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_020.text:
I know. And if I'm going to bloom,
I'm going to be stunning—but I won't
be doing it for you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_030.text:
So what was the name of
this season's Epuyke maiden?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_040.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_040.text:
The present Epuyke was once
an individual named Wakka.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_050.speaker: Tyupu
