SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_050.text:
So if I become the Epuyke, am I going
to be 'an individual once named Chup'?
Ugh. Can't say I feel good about that. Here's the deal: when I make the most
beautiful blossoms—and I am TOTALLY going
to make the most beautiful blossoms—
I want you to say 'Wooo! Chup rules!'

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_070.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_070.text:
Not NOW, you dingbat!
...But yeah, just like that.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_080.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_080.text:
Don't worry, kiddo. Me and Kup'll
celebrate you like all get-out.

SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_200_CUT_000_010.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_200_CUT_000_010.text:
You make it sound like
it grew all on its own...

SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_210_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_210_CUT_000_020.text:
This was fun when I was a kid, but now
I realize I didn't get it at ALL.

SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_210_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_210_CUT_000_030.text:
Yeah, I didn't really think much
when I was a kid, either.

SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_220_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_220_CUT_000_020.text:
Boy, they're really going nuts...
I wonder if my pollen will taste
that good.

SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_220_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_220_CUT_000_030.text:
Maybe the flavor changes based on the person?
Although honestly, I'm not sure these fellas
are really worried about how the stuff tastes.

SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_220_CUT_000_040.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_220_CUT_000_040.text:
Yeah, they're probably just hungry.
C'mon, let's go.

SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_230_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_230_CUT_000_030.text:
If you eat the pollen,
you turn into a Kikir.

SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_240_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_240_CUT_000_020.text:
I'm in the middle of my
trial thingies.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_210_CUT_000_050.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_210_CUT_000_050.text:
I'll do what I can, okay?
That's all I can really promise.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_000_000.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Maiden Chup!
Hail, Soyay the Pollinator!
The time for the ritual has come.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_000_050.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_000_050.text:
Hey, know what I just realized, Soyay?
I never asked your real name.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_000_070.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_000_070.text:
Bwaaaaaa ha ha ha ha!
Oh man, that name is HILARIOUS! Er, but thanks for everything,
Tsunanori. Seriously.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_000_080.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_000_080.text:
No! Ancikar has possessed
the maiden's body!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_000.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_000.text:
As we suspected, maidens who run from their
trials are tainted; I fear Ancikar has crept into
the crevices of her heart.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_010.text:
The heck you talking about, lady?
Chup did a bang-up job on her trials!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_020.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_020.text:
We must cut down that wicked blossom.
If we do not, Ancikar's power will spread
out across the land.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_030.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_030.text: Stop! Don't cut down my sister!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_040.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_040.text:
Now hold on just a second there. I may not know
much about the Imeru god or Ancikar, but this
here is a trial given to Chup and her Soyay,
and I'm not gonna let you touch her!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_050.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_050.text: Keep calling for your sis, Kup, 'cause I will save her.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_070.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_070.text:
Cripes almighty. I just came here looking
for a spirit, and now I've dragged poor Chup
into the middle of a real mess.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_090.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_090.text: I hear you, Sis! It's me! Kup!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_020_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_020_000.text:
I know you can hear your little sis, Chup,
and I know you don't wanna make her cry!
You're better than that—you're stronger!
So don't give in to Ancikar's dang dreams!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_030_000.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_030_000.text:
Though the wicked blossom has withered,
the Epuyke ritual has failed. What might
our god be thinking in all of this? I fear this
may portend the end of the world.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_030_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_030_010.text:
Wrong, lady. Chup is still alive—and since
we killed a ton of Ancikar's little fiends,
there's gonna be plenty of nutrients for her. She's gonna make one heck of a
beautiful flower. I know it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_030_020.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_030_020.text:
Please trust in my sister.
Trust in the Epuyke.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_030_030.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_030_030.text:
We are guided by the Imeru god's will,
and so shall watch over the Epuyke.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_040_000.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_040_000.text:
Can you hear me, Sis?
You're SUCH a pretty flower!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_040_010.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_040_010.text:
Thank you, Kup...
I heard...your voice...

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_040_020.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_040_020.text:
Honestly, Chup? I was a pretty cruddy Soyay,
and that caused you a whole lot of pain.
I'm sorry about that—and about everything.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_040_030.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_040_030.text:
Heh... You were a cruddy Soyay...
But thanks anyway, Tsunanori...

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_000.text:
Don't feel like I was much help at all
there, but I still hope she blooms into
a real beautiful flower.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_020.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_020.text:
You have borne witness to the Imeru's Epuyke
festival as the 80,136th Soyay the Pollinator.
I now pronounce you freed from your duty.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_030.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_030.text:
Hey, so should I stick around until
Chup—er, until the Epuyke blooms?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_040.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_040.text:
Half the Soyays remain to watch the Epuyke
bloom, while the other half run away as
if for their very lives. What will you do?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_050.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_050.text:
I came to this place looking for spirits,
and now Chup's become the Epuyke. Feels like
I should see this deal through to the end,
otherwise why the heck did I even come here?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_060.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_060.text:
And yet, you are now merely a man.
We cannot stand here speaking to you,
for we must be off to greet the
80,137th Soyay the Pollinator.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_100.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_100.text:
Epuyke nogonoa kowo to you,
the 80,136th Soyay the Pollinator!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_020_000.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_020_000.text:
Can you hear me, Sis?
You're SUCH a pretty flower now.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_020_080.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_020_080.text: Guess she can't hear us anymore.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_END_POLLEN_200_CUT_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_END_POLLEN_200_CUT_000.text:
Well, this is your pollen, Chup—
and since I'm your Soyay, I guess
it's my job to take it with me.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_END_POLLEN_200_CUT_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_END_POLLEN_200_CUT_000.text:
I get it now. I understand.
And I'll use this power wisely.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_060.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_060.text:
Barely, but I guess I'll make it work.
Now mind telling me what the heck's
going on with this world?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_080.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_080.text:
I wasn't summoned, lady.
Came here all on my own.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_090.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_090.text:
By the power of the god of the Imeru,
we have summoned you, the 1,080,362nd
Soyay the Pollinator, to guide the
Epuyke's maiden.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_100.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_100.text:
Sounds like I just got a new job.
Whatcha need me to do, bud?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_130.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_130.text:
Seems like a pretty important deal
to be handing over to a random guy
who just strolled on in here.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_140.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_140.text:
All is as the god of the Imeru wills it.
This is part of the original promise made
between the god of the Imeru and Ancikar—
the evil which slumbers in the earth. Alas, this season's maiden is quite the handful,
which is why I believe you have been summoned.
For of all possible Soyays in all the worlds,
you are best suited for this task.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_150.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_150.text:
See, now you're just gettin' my hopes up—
'cause the tougher a nut is to crack,
the tastier the reward at the end.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_160.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_160.text:
Now go forth and guide the maiden.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_000.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_000.text:
Welcome to Berta Village,
Soyay the Pollinator.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_010.speaker: 綱紀
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_010.text:
Good to meet you, ma'am. I'm Tsunanori Mido,
and those cleric ladies hired me on to be the
fella that guides you around.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_020.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_020.text:
Your greeting is recognized and appreciated.
I am called Yuk, and my daughter, Nana,
is who you will be guiding on her quest
to become a wonderful Epuyke.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_030.text:
Sorry! Sorry. Know I'm late—had to change,
what with me being the maiden and all.
Never really worn anything like this
before, but whatcha gonna do, am I right?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_040.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_040.text:
So I don't wanna be rude here—and I know
I just got to this world and don't know
grain from granola—but something here
seems a little bit...off.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_050.text:
What, you mean the fact Mom
and me look nothing alike?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_060.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_060.text:
Though our appearances differ, I raised Nana
as my daughter. Even our god can see she is
a proud Imeru on the inside, for this is why
she was granted the markings.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_070.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_070.text:
Huh. I kinda figured you just
drew those on yourself, maybe.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_080.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_080.text:
Nope! I just woke up one morning
and BAM! Face markings. The village freaked out, because they couldn't
believe 'that Nana'—which is how they say my name,
by the way, super judgy—they couldn't believe
'that Nana' had been chosen to be the maiden. You should have seen their faces. Seriously,
like, EVERY jaw was dragging across the ground
and their eyes were all bugging out. It made
all this maiden business completely worth it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_090.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_090.text:
The god of the Imeru has chosen my daughter,
and though I know she will bloom into a most
beautiful Epuyke, I still remain uneasy.
So please, Soyay—guide her well.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_100.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_100.text:
Sorry, you want ME to guide her?
Ma'am, I'm not even from around here.
I got no idea what to do.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_110.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_110.text:
Okay, so basically I have to go pass three
trials: strength, wisdom, and love. As my Soyay,
you and me have to work together to overcome
them before the next Epuyke withers.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_120.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_120.text:
And this Epuyke thing is...
what, exactly?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_130.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_130.text:
It's a big... Well, it's this... Look, it's gonna
be way easier to just show you, okay?
The Epuyke is gonna bloom while we're working
on the trials, so you can see it then. Cool?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_150.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_150.text:
Then let's quit standing here
and get going already! C'mon!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_160.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_160.text:
Please take care of my Nana,
Soyay the Pollinator.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_170.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_170.text:
Hey, I'll do what I can,
but no promises.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_200.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_200.text:
Okay, so let me introduce myself again:
I'm Nana, Maiden of the Epuyke. And this part I didn't want to say in front
of Mom, but I wasn't born in this world.
I mean, obviously, but figured I should just
get it all out there anyway, you know? Yeah, so I came here with another Soyay,
but when they left me behind, Mom decided
to raise me as her own. That's the story.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_210.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_210.text:
Anyway, apparently the Soyay who brought me
here wore these clothes, and for some reason
Mom insisted I wear them on my trials.
So that's why I'm dressed like this. Oh hey! Once the Epuyke ritual is over,
do you think I'll go back to the world
that Soyay came from?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_220.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_220.text:
Do you want to go back?
If you even can, I mean.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_230.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_230.text:
I dunno. I mean, I'd LOVE to get out there
and visit strange worlds, you know?
But I'm also from here, so I can't
imagine living out there forever.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_240.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_240.text:
Anyway, now you know the whole story.
So be my guide, Soyay, and be a good one.
Let's go do this thing! Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_250.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_250.text:
Cripes, that lady didn't let me get a dang
word in edgewise. Could've at least asked
what my name was...

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_000.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Nana, maiden of the Epuyke!
Hail, Soyay the Pollinator!
I stand ready to bear witness
to the Trial of Wisdom.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_010.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_010.text:
Do you know what this
trial entails, Nana?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_020.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_020.text:
The Trial of Wisdom is a test of one's wisdom,
knowledge, and discretion, and is undertaken
to determine whether or not a maiden is suited
to become the Epuyke.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_030.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_030.text:
I am pleased to see you were not raised by
Yuk with nothing to show for it. That said,
the Trial of Wisdom also reaffirms your
connection with the land.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_040.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_040.text:
So I'll be looking back on the
time I've spent here?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_050.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_050.text:
If I may speak plainly, we are all
rather perplexed as to why the god
of the Imeru has chosen you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_060.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_060.text:
Okay, seriously? I've got TONS of memories
with the land, which the god of the Imeru
would totally know. I am an Imeru, just like
everyone else. It isn't that hard.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_070.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_070.text:
This is true—and yet, we cannot help but
look at the differences which separate you
from the rest of our kind. Perhaps this is a revelation from the god of
the Imeru asking us to be more considerate of
what lies inside? Regardless, I pray you might 
overcome the Trial of Wisdom.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_080.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_080.text:
So am I the only one who has no
idea what the heck she's supposed
to be doing here?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_090.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_090.text:
She must collect fragments of the Epuyke Tablet
which have been scattered across the land,
put them back together, and decipher the tale
written upon it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_120.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_120.text:
Oh, I'm going to decipher it, all right—
and when I do, you'll see that my heart
is no different from yours!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_130.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_130.text:
So no hints as to how many fragments we're
lookin' for here? Or where they are, maybe?
Or is solving this thing blind all part
of having wisdom?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_140.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_140.text:
You have seen the truth of it, Soyay.
Now go find the fragments and return to me.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_300_CUT_000_000.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_300_CUT_000_000.text:
Look! A fragment of the Epuyke Tablet!
Oh, and there's a pattern carved on it!
Am I supposed to decipher this? Really?
Because I have ZERO idea what I'm looking at.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_300_CUT_000_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_300_CUT_000_010.text:
It's writing, right? I mean, since you
need to read a tale off it and all.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_300_CUT_000_020.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_300_CUT_000_020.text:
Yeah, so I've heard the tablet is actually
born at the same time the maiden appears?
It grows up from the ground just like this. Some people say the dreams of the Ancikar are
carved into it, but other people say it actually
contains a divine message from the Imeru god.
Truth is, nobody knows for sure.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_300_CUT_000_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_300_CUT_000_030.text:
Oh, and I was also told the fragments would
appear in places that are important to me,
but I've never even BEEN to this place before,
so that's just weird.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_310_CUT_000_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_310_CUT_000_010.text:
These fellas are bigger
than I thought they'd be.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_310_CUT_000_020.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_310_CUT_000_020.text:
Mom used to bring me here sometimes—she'd
stare at the Epuyke and then cry all quietly.
I'd always pretend not to notice, because I
just had a feeling I wasn't supposed to ask.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_310_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_310_CUT_000_030.text:
The Epuyke is a flower that keeps everything
here alive, yeah? Maybe your mom has some
kind of memory with it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_310_CUT_000_040.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_310_CUT_000_040.text:
Yeah, maybe. You know, I thought a lot about
the maidens and how they must've felt when they
became the Epuyke. Were they embarrassed to have
everyone staring at them? Or were they proud?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_310_CUT_000_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_310_CUT_000_050.text: Still, even with all that thinking, I never imagined I'd be chosen to be the maiden. Always figured it'd be someone else's problem.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_310_CUT_000_060.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_310_CUT_000_060.text: So how do you feel about it now?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_310_CUT_000_070.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_310_CUT_000_070.text:
I dunno. I just wonder if Mom's gonna look
at me and cry once I turn into the Epuyke.
That's all I can think about right now.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_320_CUT_000_020.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_320_CUT_000_020.text:
Oh wow, this is the same as our birth-seed husks!
See, whenever an Imeru is born, the parents save
the husk and turn it into some kind of accessory
the kids can wear around.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_320_CUT_000_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_320_CUT_000_030.text:
But I never got an accessory—and when I asked Mom
why, she didn't know how to answer. Of course,
now I know it's because I wasn't born from a seed,
but at the time it made zero sense.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_320_CUT_000_040.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_320_CUT_000_040.text:
Anyway, one day she brought out this super old
husk from the storehouse and said it was mine,
but I knew that wasn't true. So I burst out
crying and she just kind of...stood there.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_320_CUT_000_050.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_320_CUT_000_050.text: Sounds like a kid, all right.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_320_CUT_000_060.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_320_CUT_000_060.text:
Later, I went to the storehouse and found
the box where the husk was stored. The name
'Nuy' was written on it, but I've never
gotten up the guts to ask Mom who that is.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_320_CUT_000_070.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_320_CUT_000_070.text:
...Wow. I've never told anyone that
story before. I suppose this means
I really trust you, huh?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_320_CUT_000_080.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_320_CUT_000_080.text:
I appreciate it. And don't worry—
your secret's safe with this guy.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_330_CUT_000_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_330_CUT_000_010.text:
I wonder what it says? I mean, you were
going on and on about how it'll be proof
of your heart to that witness lady, yeah?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_330_CUT_000_020.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_330_CUT_000_020.text:
Oh, I was just irritated by the stuff she
was saying—I'm a whole lot calmer now.
Honestly, whatever's written on the tablet
isn't going to surprise me. Probably.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_330_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_TABLET_330_CUT_000_030.text:
Can't be more surprising than learning
you were gonna be the maiden, eh?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_000_000.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_000_000.text:
Maiden Nana, you have collected
all the Epuyke Tablet fragments.
Now put them together, if you can.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_010_010.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_010_010.text:
Thus marks the end of the Trial of Wisdom.
Whether you choose to speak of the message
written on the tablet or keep it to yourself
is a decision made at your discretion.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_010_030.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_010_030.text:
Of course. It is a revelation
meant for you alone.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_010_040.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_010_040.text:
As your witness, I was unsure if the tablet
fragments would grow—or if your Soyay would
even be able to find them. But the will of the Imeru god is ever wise,
and I am relieved to see you were able to
complete the trial.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_010_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_010_050.text:
You know, people have always said terrible
things about me behind my back—called me an
animal and worse. And Mom... Well, you don't
even want to KNOW the things they said to her. But you know what? Screw 'em. I'm gonna
become the Epuyke and bless this land
no matter WHAT they all think of me!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_000.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_000.text:
Oh, who am I kidding!? I can't do this!
I'm not an Imeru, I don't have a husk—
there's no WAY I can put this together! Clearly, the god of the Imeru just gave
me these markings as a punishment.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_010.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_010.text:
There have been other maidens who have been
unable to overcome every trial, Nana—you must
not give up. All is according to the will of the
Imeru's god, after all.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_020.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_020.text:
And if that lady says it, you know it's true.
Now get your head back in the game, yeah?
No one's trying to punish you here.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_030.text:
Sorry. I'm sorry.
Just lost myself a bit.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_050.text: I can't do it. There's no way.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_060.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_060.text:
So be it, Nana, Maiden of the Epuyke.
So be it, Soyay the Pollinator.
All I can do now is pray you safely
finish the ritual. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_000.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_000.text:
Okay, so I read the tablet, and it
told me to go to the Kieru Ruins.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_010.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_010.text:
I see. You may reach the ruins by taking the
branching path managed by the Kikir in the
cavern that connects to Doroso Village.
I will notify the Kikir to expect you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_020.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_020.text:
Is going to these ruins
part of the trial?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_030.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_030.text:
No. The trial ended when the maiden finished
deciphering the tablet. Whether or not you
choose to follow the tablet's instruction
is up to the two of you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_040.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_040.text:
So what're these Kieru Ruins
like, anyway?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_050.text:
I don't know—I've never been.
The Kikir manage that area,
so the Imeru don't go there.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_080.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_080.text:
Hear me, Nana, Maiden of the Epuyke!
Hear me, Soyay the Pollinator!
I pray that you might safely finish
the Epuyke ritual. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_100.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_100.text:
Well, what's it gonna be? Do we go check
out the Kieru Ruins, or should we focus
on the rest of the trials?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_110.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_110.text:
The tablet is a revelation from the god of the
Imeru—and though I am not Imeru, I know I was
given these markings for a reason, so I feel
like I have to do as the tablet says...

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_130.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_130.text: So let's go find the ruins.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_030_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_030_010.text:
And? What did it say?
Was it bad news?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_030_030.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_030_030.text:
The words of the tablet may remain
forever in your heart if you wish it.
My role is to witness, not to know.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_030_060.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_030_060.text:
Hear me, Nana, Maiden of the Epuyke.
Hear me, Soyay the Pollinator.
All I can do now is pray you safely
finish the Epuyke ritual.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_030_070.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_WISDOM_310_CUT_030_070.text:
I'll do what I can, but I just don't know
how this is going to turn out.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_300_CUT_000_000.speaker: Kikiris
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_300_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Nana, Maiden of the Epuyke!
Hail, Soyay the Pollinator! I hear the revelation on the Epuyke Tablet
bid you come to this place. This will be an
inconvenience to the people of Doroso Village,
but they will simply have to make their peace.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_300_CUT_000_010.speaker: Kikiris
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_300_CUT_000_010.text:
The path is connected—please go ahead.
Also, so far as I know, there is nothing
within the Kieru Ruins, but I trust it is
important to you. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_000_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_000_000.text:
If this place is a ruin, it means
someone used to live here, yeah?
I wonder what the deal was.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_000_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_000_030.text: Do you mind if I walk ahead?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_000_040.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_000_040.text:
Not sure I should leave you
alone here, actually.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_000_060.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_000_060.text:
Sure, okay—but just for a bit.
Holler if something happens, yeah?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_000.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_000.text:
I found this on the ground—there's something
written on it that I can't read. I think it may
have belonged to a past Soyay?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_010.text:
Looks like a notebook.
Mind if I take a peek?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_030.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_030.text:
Might take a bit, but I'll get the
hang of it. Just think of it as more
of my swell Soyay powers.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_050.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_050.text:
'May 3rd...' Yep, this is a diary,
all right—although I've got no idea how
old the sucker is. Anyway, let's see...

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_060.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_060.text:
'For reasons unclear, I have been summoned
to this world by some sort of magic. I am apparently
meant to walk with someone labeled a 'maiden'
and aid her in a series of trials.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_070.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_070.text:
But I have only a few days supply
of both diapers and milk remaining,
and I don't know what to do.'

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_080.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_080.text:
I was right! This WAS left
by a previous Soyay!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_100.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_100.text:
'When I awoke, I thought for a moment this
 had all been a dream, but it was not to be.
Time is...strange here—fluid—which is why
I have decided to write all of this down.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_110.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_110.text:
The easiest way to return to my world is to 
abandon the maiden, but am torn as to whether
or not this is an ethical decision to make. I have no one else to talk to.
I don't know what to do.
I cannot leave Nana alone.'

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_140.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_140.text:
'I spoke to the clerics; the maiden's
mother will look after Nana while I'm off
helping her daughter on the trials. I know Nuy will not return home if I am
successful, and yet I still feel this is
something I must do.'

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_160.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_160.text:
Hey, I'm nowhere near smart enough to
make this whole thing up on the spot.
You want me to stop?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_190.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_190.text:
'Today, I set out on my trials
with the maiden, Nuy. Her mother, Yuk, will be taking care of Nana
while I'm away—and even though Yuk's own
daughter is going to become the Epuyke,
all she does is fuss over me and Nana.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_200.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_200.text:
I don't know much about this world, but I do
know this: Yuk is a good person—even though
I would lose my mind if someone told me
Nana had to become this Epuyke thing.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_210.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_210.text:
When these trials are over—when we return
to our world and Nana grows up—I'll tell
her about everything that happened here. She's probably going to think I'm making
it up—or that I'm mad—and I won't be able
to blame her for either one. Perhaps I'll even write a book about
this place one day—I imagine it would
sell quite well.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_220.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_220.text:
Oh, one last thing: I learned to say 'Epuyke
nogonoa kowo' in the local dialect. People say
this to me constantly, and it roughly means,
'May the blossoms of the Epuyke watch over you.'

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_230.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_230.text:
Well, it's time for me to go.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo, my precious Nana.'

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_250.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_250.text:
Y'know, I had my doubts about this
'god of the Imeru' fella, but he
really came through on this one.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_260.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_260.text:
...You okay there, Nana?
Should I not have read that?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_270.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_270.text:
I don't know... I have no idea how I'm
supposed to feel after hearing all that!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_280.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_280.text:
You good now? I know I always
feel better after I let it all out.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_290.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_290.text:
Yeah, I'm better—but we're heading back 
to the village. I'm done pretending I don't
know about any of this, and it's time to
hear what Mom has to say.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_000.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_000.text:
I found this on the ground—do you know
what it is? I think it may have belonged
to a past Soyay, because it's definitely
not from this world.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_010.text: It's some kind of digital device.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_020.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_020.text:
Guess I should press this button.
Sure hope the puppy doesn't explode...

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_030.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_030.text:
FILE GREEN 105:
RE: THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN
ANCIKAR AND THE MAIDEN

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_040.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_040.text:
The residents claim the Epuyke flower
purifies the dreams of an evil deity
they call Ancikar. But if we assume that to be true, surely this
evil god would consider the process of a maiden
becoming the flower and absorbing its power
to be an act of aggression.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_050.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_050.text:
But no hostile relationship can last forever,
so perhaps this is better thought of as kind
of forced symbiosis where both the maiden
and Ancikar gain something.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_060.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_060.text:
FILE GREEN 080:
QUESTIONABILITY OF ANCIKAR'S EXISTENCE

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_070.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_070.text: Has any resident actually seen the evil deity Ancikar? The clerics refuse to answer when I ask to see records of its awakening—or to even confirm such records exist at all.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_080.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_080.text:
Perhaps Ancikar is not a living being at all,
but instead a metaphor for natural phenomena—
one which serves much the same purpose as dragons
and demons in the myths of other worlds. If so, there would be records of eruptions,
floods, and the like—and these things would
still be happening.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_090.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_090.text:
The Imeru have a magical civilization mature
enough to summon ritual attendants from other
worlds, yet continue carrying out an arcane
practice where one of them becomes the Epuyke. It is a truly fascinating dichotomy.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_100.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_100.text:
FILE GREEN 208:
RE: THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN
ANCIKAR AND THE MAIDEN #36

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_110.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_110.text:
Let us assume for the moment the hypothesis
that the maiden does not absorb and purify
Ancikar's magic is correct. Perhaps, then, in exchange for receiving the
maiden's life force in the form of her soul,
Ancikar returns that same force to the earth
in the form of energy.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_120.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_120.text:
FILE GREEN 005:
RE: THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN
ANCIKAR AND THE MAIDEN #908

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_130.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_130.text:
What if Ancikar does not exist as an individual
being, but is instead an aggregate of all the
sacrificed maidens' souls? How much remorse
and anger would such a creature possibly hold?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_140.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_140.text:
And what if the Maiden's Garden—the place
said to be the destination for the souls
of all maidens who become the Epuyke—
is Ancikar itself?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_160.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_160.text:
I came here by chance as an inspector,
and have been attempting to examine my
hypotheses and speculations from the
viewpoint of a rational scholar. And yet, there is a mythical makeup
to this world that science, biology,
and even folklore cannot fully explain.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_170.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_170.text: An example of this is how those who ingest the Epuyke's pollen are unable to leave this world. ...But it tasted so good.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_180.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_180.text:
I believe roughly 50,000 cycles of base time have
passed since I arrived. And while many others—
called Pollinators—have been summoned here, there
have been no other inspectors from the base. This is most unfortunate. Sadly, there's little
I can do other than leave this here in the hopes
that another of my kind will eventually find
their way here and read it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_200.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_200.text:
I don't understand any of that.
What were they trying to say?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_210.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_210.text:
I think whoever wrote that was here for
a long time and REAL bored, so they
amused themselves by rolling ideas
around in their skull. Probably would've thought nicer things
if they had more contact with the Imeru
or the Kikir, but there ya go.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_220.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_220.text:
So tell me... Do you think all the
maidens are actually Ancikar?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_230.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_230.text:
No. No, that's not possible. I mean,
it would be the gravest of insults to
think of the maidens as evil. I mean, sure, waking up one morning with markings
that mean you're now a maiden is probably hard to
accept for some people. But the idea it leads to
a grudge? To some kind of...eternal rage? No. Whoever wrote all of that clearly
doesn't understand the Imeru at all.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_240.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_240.text:
Fair enough. But if we believe the god of the
Imeru showed me that on purpose, maybe it wants
me to think how I should be interacting with the
Epuyke's maiden as her Soyay. Telling me to think about how
I deal with you, in other words.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_250.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_250.text:
So how WILL you deal with me,
Soyay? What will you do?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_260.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_260.text:
Won't know until this is all over.
All I gotta do now is play my role
as Soyay and help however I can.
So until then, Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_000.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_000.text:
There are so many things I want to talk
to you about, Mom, but I don't even
know where to... I mean...

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_010.text:
We found Hasumi's diary after the god
of the Imeru led us to the Kieru Ruins,
and there was a heck of a lot of stuff
in there that was news to Nana.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_020.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_020.text:
Is that so? I was unaware Hasumi
left any records behind... Yes, well, let me start from the beginning.
This is all from memory, mind, so it might differ
slightly from Hasumi's diary, but believe me
when I say I have no intention to deceive you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_030.text:
It's okay, Mom. I know you're
not that kind of person.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_040.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_040.text:
Nuy received the markings of the maiden when
she was younger than Nana is now. Everyone was
delighted to have a maiden from Berta Village,
and our family doubly so.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_050.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_050.text:
Soon, the Soyay arrived—that was Hasumi—
with a baby in her arms. The child was
far different than Imeru seedlings,
but adorable all the same.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_060.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_060.text:
None of us had ever heard of a Soyay with a baby,
including the clerics. Seeing them at a loss for
how to handle the situation, I offered to care
for the child—for you, Nana.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_070.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_070.text:
Nuy and Hasumi left soon thereafter
on the journey of trials, but along
the way, Hasumi...she perished.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_080.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_080.text:
Yet Nuy managed through to the end
and bloomed into a beautiful Epuyke—
one filled both with her own spirit
and the steadfast heart of Hasumi.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_090.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_090.text:
Hasumi left this for me before she departed,
and told me to give this to Nana should
anything happen. I should have done this
much sooner, but... Well, here it is.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_100.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_100.text:
Looks like a photo from her original world.
This baby must be Nana, and I'm guessing
the lady holding her is her mom, Hasumi? Got a bunch of other folks here too,
but I dunno how they could all be
related to you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_120.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_120.text:
Yep, and they all look happy. Real happy,
too—not the fakey smiles that tend to
happen when we take pictures in my world.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_130.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_130.text:
I raised you in Hasumi's stead.
It was difficult, since you are
not Imeru, but I could not bear
the thought of losing you. That's why I never showed you this
picture: because if you saw it and
chose to leave, I...I couldn't...

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_140.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_140.text: I know how hard you worked for me, Mom, and I'm truly, truly grateful. Without you, I would have been dead a long time ago. So no matter what I learn and no matter what I see, I will always be your little girl.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_150.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_150.text:
But I do have one question:
why did you dress me in my
birth-mother's clothes?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_160.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_160.text:
I thought the god of the Imeru might
have chosen you as the maiden so you could
return to your original world, and... Well, I suppose I just
wanted you to fit in.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_170.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_170.text:
I'm Imeru, Mom—I wouldn't have the faintest
IDEA what to do if I was thrown back into my
own world after all this time. I think the
god of the Imeru understands that.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_180.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_180.text:
Well, now that you've learned all this,
what's the plan? You still interested
in being the Epuyke's maiden?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_190.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_190.text:
Even though I'm very confused about what
the Imeru god wants from me, I'm going
to do what I am meant to do.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_200.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_200.text: I love you, Mom. Epuyke nogonoa kowo.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.text:
Welcome, Nana, maiden of the Epuyke.
And you as well, Soyay the Pollinator.
I am the witness for the Trial of Strength.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.text:
Do you understand the relationship
between Ancikar and the Epuyke, Maiden?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.text:
Sure do! The Epuyke transforms the evil god
Ancikar's dreams into blessings for the land,
keeping Ancikar asleep and protecting us all
from his wickedness.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.text:
You speak true. Then tell me, do you
understand the relationship between
the Imeru and the Kikir?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.text:
The Imeru provide the Maiden of
the Epuyke, while the Kikir fight
Ancikar's fiends. Some Imeru think the Kikir don't do anything,
but that's wrong. All of them put their lives
on the line every day for this world's
peace and prosperity.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.text:
My mom's been teaching me about all of this
since I was young; she wanted to make sure
I understood this world better than anyone.
And I was interested in the Kikir anyway.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.text:
I expect no less from Yuk. She comes from
a line of exceptional maidens, and raised you
to be a fine individual. This is doubtless why
you were chosen to be the maiden!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.text:
I know many Imeru who have strong opinions on
your being a maiden, but we Kikir mind not the
differences between you and the maidens of the
past. We care only that you believe in yourself.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.text:
That's all well and good, fella,
but what exactly do I do here?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_1.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_1.text:
Sure, sounds easy enough.
Let's go find us a fiend.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_1.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_1.text:
Lead the Epuyke's maiden well, Soyay
the Pollinator. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_310_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_310_CUT_000_0.text:
If this trial's gonna happen,
it's gonna be here.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_310_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_310_CUT_000_0.text:
Know that many Soyay lives have
been forfeited in this very trial,
so do not let your guard down. I shall now summon the fiend...
O great god of the Kikir, bring us
a mighty fiend from a world beyond!
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_310_CUT_010_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_310_CUT_010_0.text:
Hear me, Nana, Maiden of the Epuyke!
Hear me, Soyay the Pollinator! You have done very well in your trial,
and I pray you might become the Epuyke.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.text:
You are Hasumi's daughter,
are you not?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.text: So it seems. Is that a problem?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.text:
Those of us who aid in the Epuyke's trials
do not record the names of either maidens
or Soyay, for to do so may lead to doubts
over the Imeru god's choices.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.text:
However, no summoner of strength could
ever forget the names of Hasumi or Nuy,
because it is they who taught us the true
meaning of the trials.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.text:
We believed the trial of strength was simply
a way to test the Soyay's physical prowess.
We thought there was only meaning in victory. Alas, our thinking was shallow;
the significance of the trial
runs far, far deeper.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.text: Though Hasumi lost her life in the trial, her heart was bound to Nuy—and consequently, Nuy bloomed into a beautiful Epuyke. So you see, the true significance of this trial is to test the bond between the hearts of the maiden and her Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.text:
Hear me, Nana, Maiden of the Epuyke.
Hear me, Soyay the Pollinator.
I expect your hearts to find their
true bond through this trial.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.text:
Well, that's one dead fiend.
Feel bonded yet, bud?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.text:
I'm not sure about that, but I DO know
I wanted you to win more than anything! Still, I'm sure Nuy was thinking the same
thing when she watched Hasumi fight,
and Hasumi ended up losing anyway.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.text:
If Hasumi's the kind of gal I think she is,
I bet she felt real bad about leaving Nuy
with such a mess.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.text:
Felt bad? How could she feel BAD!?
She gave her own LIFE for Nuy—
what more could she do!? I mean, what are the people who get left
behind even supposed to DO with that?
Hell, maybe the only choice is to
risk my OWN life and—

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.text:
Whoa, let's just simmer down there,
champ. I'm still alive, which means
you don't need to shoulder anything.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.text:
I have just witnessed a miracle: Hasumi's heart
has crossed the boundaries of time to bond with
her daughter. I will now cherish and care for
this trial even more. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_300_CUT_000_000.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_300_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Nana, maiden of the Epuyke!
Hail, Soyay the Pollinator!
I stand ready to bear witness
to the Trial of Love. Your task is thus: take these
vine seeds and plant them in
the holes upon the plateaus.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_300_CUT_000_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_300_CUT_000_030.text:
Um... Aren't you going to ask
me the meaning of this trial?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_300_CUT_000_040.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_300_CUT_000_040.text:
What meaning the maiden assigns to
this trial is left to her discretion. What meaning is there in choosing the holes?
In spreading the seeds? In Ancikar's fiends?
In the very vines themselves? I would have you think on all these
things with a heart full of love.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_310_CUT_000_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_310_CUT_000_000.text:
Yep. That's a hole, all right.
Wanna go with this one?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_310_CUT_010_010.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_310_CUT_010_010.text:
I've always tried to picture what
kind of seed I sprouted from. I mean, I figure it's different from most
other people's, so I always imagined it 
as being sort of transparent and shiny.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_310_CUT_010_020.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_310_CUT_010_020.text:
You weren't born from a seed—
or at least I'm pretty sure you weren't. See, in the world I'm from, life comes from
everywhere. Some comes from seeds, some come
from eggs—and folks like you and me are
born from our mothers' stomachs.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_310_CUT_010_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_310_CUT_010_030.text:
WHAAAT!? But if you sprouted from your
mom's stomach, that means she DIED!
Nuh-uh, no way! Keep your creepy
world the hell away from me!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_310_CUT_010_040.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_310_CUT_010_040.text:
Yeah, no. That's not exactly...
I mean, it's... Hoo boy.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_310_CUT_020_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_310_CUT_020_000.text:
Well, that was an Ancikar fiend, which
means we should be good for nutrients.
Now I guess we just wait for it to bud?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_310_CUT_030_000.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_310_CUT_030_000.text:
So what meaning is there in the vines, huh?
I mean, I've been thinking with a loving heart
like I'm supposed to, but I can't see anything
but...you know. Vines. Is this what it's like to become
the Epuyke? It seems so superficial.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_310_CUT_030_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_310_CUT_030_010.text:
Where I come from, it takes a bit
for seeds to grow once you plant 'em. But planting seeds always leads to
important stuff in the future, which is
why it's important to do it—both literally
and metaphorically, I guess.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_310_CUT_030_020.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_LOVE_310_CUT_030_020.text:
That's the first Soyay-like thing you've
ever said to me! Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_000.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_000.text:
At last you have come, Nana,
Maiden of the Epuyke. This season's Epuyke blossomed full and
beautiful. It absorbed the dreams of the
evil god Ancikar who slumbers underground,
then brilliantly returned to the earth.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_020.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_020.text:
Aren't you nervous because
I'm not Imeru?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_030.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_030.text:
You have been chosen by the god of the Imeru.
To find unease in this fact would be to show
distrust and insult to our deity.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_040.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_040.text:
You were raised here. You are Imeru.
We expect great things from you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_050.text:
And I'm gonna do everything I can
to live up to those expectations!

SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_300_CUT_000_010.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_300_CUT_000_010.text:
It didn't grow out of the ground
itself... There was a maiden...

SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_320_CUT_000_040.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_320_CUT_000_040.text:
Only people who want seeds eat pollen.
I'm, uh...not old enough for that yet.

SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_330_CUT_000_020.speaker: Kikiris1
SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_330_CUT_000_020.text:
Become the Epuyke!
Feed us tasty pollen!

SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_330_CUT_000_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_330_CUT_000_030.text: Do you think I can do that?

SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_330_CUT_000_040.speaker: Kikiris2
SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_330_CUT_000_040.text:
Absolutely! I know you'll shower
us with tasty, tasty pollen.

SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_340_CUT_000_020.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_GIMK_MIDO_POLLEN_340_CUT_000_020.text: I'm working on my trials now.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_310_CUT_000_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_310_CUT_000_050.text:
So I'm absolutely going to do my
best here, but I have one request: When I become the Epuyke, will you please
look after Mom? I want her to live the
rest of her life without worry.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_310_CUT_000_060.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_310_CUT_000_060.text:
Worry not, she will be treated very well.
Relatives of the Epuyke are valuable—and as
she raised you to be the Maiden of the Epuyke,
her experience is doubly so.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_310_CUT_000_070.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_310_CUT_000_070.text: Well, you're right about that: Mom is an exceptional Imeru.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_310_CUT_000_080.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_FLOWER_310_CUT_000_080.text:
We pray you will bloom into an
equally exceptional Epuyke.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_000_000.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Maiden Nana!
Hail, Soyay the Pollinator!
The time for the ritual has come.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_000_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_000_050.text:
I finally feel like I can do this, Soyay—
and if I DO manage to become the Epuyke,
it'll all be because of you. So...thanks.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_000_060.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_000_060.text: Yep. You're gonna be just fine.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_050.text:
If I manage to become the Epuyke, it's
all going to be because of you, Soyay.
Thanks for everything you did for me.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_060.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_060.text: And thanks to your two moms.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_070.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_070.text:
You're right. I feel like...
I can do this.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_110.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_110.text:
This is Nana... Heck, she really
did become the Epuyke. *sniff* Well, would ya look at that.
I'm crying.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_120.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_120.text:
I questioned the Imeru god's choice at first,
just as I did when her mother was summoned as
the Soyay—but I see now all was done according
to our god's great plan. Praise be to mother and daughter!
Praise be to Soyay and Epuyke!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_320_CUT_000_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_320_CUT_000_050.text:
Do you think I'll be able to bloom
into the Epuyke? I mean, I haven't
actually done ANYTHING!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_320_CUT_000_060.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_320_CUT_000_060.text:
It's your god's will, bud.
Never question it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_070.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_070.text:
It will not work. The ritual is a failure.
Ancikar refuses to accept a maiden
that is not Imeru!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_090.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_090.text:
I couldn't do it, Soyay! I'm useless!
My body is useless and I can't change it!
Why did the Imeru god even choose me!?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_100.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_100.text: I will graft in her place.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_110.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_110.text:
Return to your people, Nana.
This is the will of the Imeru god.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_120.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_120.text:
Indeed. Ancikar will most
certainly accept Yuk.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_140.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_140.text:
There's no time!
Come, Yuk! This way!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_340_CUT_010_000.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_340_CUT_010_000.text:
That animal body was quite convenient for
Ancikar, was it not? Indeed, Ancikar has never
before manifested in this manner!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_340_CUT_010_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_340_CUT_010_010.text:
Who ya calling an animal there, pal!?
This is just part of the trial—a trial the
god of the Imeru gave to this guy!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_340_CUT_010_020.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_340_CUT_010_020.text:
Nana, can you hear me!? I'm gonna
save you, but I need you to fight.
Okay? You have to fight!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_340_CUT_020_010.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_340_CUT_020_010.text:
A great deal of Ancikar's power was necessary
to transform Maiden Nana into the Epuyke;
the god of the Imeru summoned a most
powerful Soyay for this very reason.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_340_CUT_020_020.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_340_CUT_020_020.text:
Nope. This was all Nana's heart.
Her heart defeated Ancikar's dreams.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_340_CUT_020_030.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_340_CUT_020_030.text:
Indeed, we stand corrected:
this Epuyke had a heart more
like an Imeru than any other.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_000.text:
You're incredible, Nana—you actually
bloomed into the Epuyke! You crossed
the species line with your heart alone! I'm glad as heck that I got to be
your Soyay, and I know you'll bloom
into a real beautiful flower.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_020.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_020.text:
You have borne witness to the Imeru's
Epuyke festival as the 1,080,362nd
Soyay the Pollinator. I now pronounce
you freed from your duty.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_030.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_030.text:
That's swell, but do you think I
can maybe stick around until Nana...
er, until the Epuyke blooms?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_050.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_050.text: I watched her lead a life that was completely different from mine— and heck, I'm still watching it. So I just want to wait a little longer, if you don't mind. Just long enough to see her bloom, maybe?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_060.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_060.text:
You are now merely a man, and we
cannot stand here speaking to you,
for we must be off to greet the
1,080,363rd Soyay the Pollinator.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_070.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_070.text:
But we have one thing for you.
The Epuyke was clad in these.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_080.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_080.text:
Nana's clothes? ...Nope. I can't take
these. Give 'em to her mom.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_100.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_100.text:
Epuyke nogonoa kowo to you,
the 1,080,362nd Soyay the Pollinator!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_020_060.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_020_060.text: Guess she can't hear us anymore...

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_030_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_030_010.text:
Eh, I'm not the Soyay anymore.
Just a regular fella now.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_030_020.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_030_020.text:
You will always be Nana's Soyay—
and as such, I would like you
to take these when you go.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_030_040.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_030_040.text:
She chose to live her life as an Imeru,
but I believe she harbored a wish in
her heart to see other worlds. So please...
Take at least a part of her with you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_030_050.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_030_050.text:
All right. Ready to go see
all sorts of worlds, Nana?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_000.text:
Cripes almighty, this is a terrible ending.
This god of the Imeru fella has pretty lousy
taste when it comes to this kind of thing, eh?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_010.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_010.text:
A question we hope to ask the god ourselves,
for never once has a Soyay so irresponsible
ever been summoned to us. But enough of this—we must begin the
trials for the next maiden and Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_020.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_020.text:
You have borne witness to the Imeru's
Epuyke festival as the 1,080,362nd
Soyay the Pollinator, and I now
pronounce you freed from your duty. Now please leave.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_030.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_030.text: Don't have to tell this guy twice.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_050.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_050.text:
An apology from the Imeru god, is it?
Oof. Nana won't be happy about this.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_010_000.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_010_000.text:
I sure hope you're okay with this, Mom.
I mean, at least you'll have company,
since Nuy is in the Maiden's Garden. I know now that Nuy's my older sister,
and I really hope you both find peace.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_010_010.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_010_010.text:
I miss you, Mom, and I...
I don't know what I’m going
to do without you. *sniff*

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_010_020.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_010_020.text:
Chin up there, slugger. Your mom'll
worry if she sees those tears.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_010_040.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_010_040.text:
Now let's go watch Yuk bloom
together, eh? How's that sound?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_020_040.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_020_040.text: What is it, Mom? Did you see Nuy?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_020_060.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_020_060.text:
She's gone to the Maiden's Garden...
I sure hope she's happy getting to
see Nuy again after all this time.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_000.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_000.text:
Thank you for everything, Soyay.
I mean it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_010.text:
Eh, I'm not the Soyay anymore—
I'm just plain old Tsunanori Mido. So what are you gonna do now?
You know, if you don't have plans,
you could travel with me for a bit.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_030.text: I'm an Imeru. My place is here.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_040.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_040.text:
Mom wanted me to leave this world once
my trials were finished, and that's exactly
what I'm gonna do! Er, I mean, if that's
all right with you, Tsunanori?

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_050.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_050.text: You know it is. Now let's roll.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_070.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_070.text:
Thanks, but I'm Imeru, and I need
to protect my mom's lineage. One day, I'll eat the Epuyke's pollen,
harbor a seed inside me, and raise a
maiden like Nuy. I just hope I can
do it all as good as Mom did.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_080.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_080.text: You will, Nana. I know it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_090.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_090.text:
Oh, but I don't need these clothes anymore,
so you can have them. I'd like you to take them
to my birth mother's world if you ever get the
chance. But for now, Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_END_POLLEN_300_CUT_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_END_POLLEN_300_CUT_000.text:
Well, this is your pollen, Nana—
and since I'm your Soyay, I guess
it's my job to take it with me.

SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RETURN_999_CUT_000_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W11_EVAR_MIDO_RETURN_999_CUT_000_000.text:
Guess I should probably
take the Epuyke's pollen.
